string.text:
%c[ui_gray_2]Available main menu keybinds on debug mode: 
 
%c[d_orange]On loaded game only: 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]F7:%c[ui_gray_2] Start Anomaly debugger 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]1:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch info feedback of left panel 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]2:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch info feedback of middle panel 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]3:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch info feedback of right panel 
 
%c[d_orange]Without a loaded game: 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]F2:%c[ui_gray_2] Launch test map 
 
%c[d_orange]Both cases: 
%c[pda_blue]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 0:%c[ui_gray_2] Reload system_ini()

%c[ui_gray_1]Tronex / Rezy 
Added: 2019/6/1 
Last edit: 2020/2/22 
Anomaly Weather Editor 2.0 
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_2] 
Weather editor allows you to change weather values in real-time. Minute precision. 
The GUI is interactive and easy to use, with ability to modify or create weather files on the fly. 
Modified values are temporarly cached for the weathers and hours you were working on. 
You can return to them in case you turned off the editor (Avoid exiting or reloading when you have unsaved values). 
In (Viewer) mode, you can witness weather changes by the time slider. 
 
%c[pda_blue]Keybinds%c[ui_gray_2]
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Arrow keys: %c[ui_gray_2]parameters navigation. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LShift (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 value step size / jump 2 parameters. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LAlt (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 value step size / jump 3 parameters.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]R/F: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce selected value. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]T/G: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce all values of selected parameter. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Q/A: %c[ui_gray_2]select next/previous hour. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]W/S: %c[ui_gray_2]select next/previous minute. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]E/D: %c[ui_gray_2]select next/previous saved moment.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Z: %c[ui_gray_2]start viewer mode.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]C: %c[ui_gray_2]copy select paramter value. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]C + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]copy current settings. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]V: %c[ui_gray_2]paste/apply copied parameter value. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]V + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]paste/apply to current settings.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Delete: %c[ui_gray_2]reset current modified moment. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Delete + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]reset all modified moments. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]H: %c[ui_gray_2]toggle help window. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Esc or Home: %c[ui_gray_2]turn off editor.
Save to new file if you indicated the name in box below, otherwise save to current file. \nName of custom files must start with "w_".
Exit (weather will still paused in engine)
File new (%s) is not valid. \nFile name must start with "w_" \nTip: empty name will save to curent file

%c[ui_gray_1]Tronex/Rezy 
2019/9/15 
Weapon HUD Editor 
 
%c[pda_green]About%c[ui_gray_2] 
Weapon HUD editor allows you to change Weapon HUD position and orientation in real-time. 
The GUI is interactive and easy to use, with ability to save adjusted pos in a temp file "temp_hud.ltx". 
Edited values are temporarly cached for the weapons you worked on. You can return to them in case you turned off the editor (Avoid exiting or reloading when you have unsaved values). 
 
%c[pda_red]Attention%c[ui_gray_2] 
Weapons configs must be unpacked before working with the editor, they must be in (%c[ui_gray_3]gamedata/configs/items/weapons%c[ui_gray_2]). 
Changes saved to HUD parameters won't take effect directly until you restart the game. 
For parameters that affect aiming positioning, enable aim toggle in options first and aim with the gun, then use the editor to see your changes. 
(%c[ui_gray_3]gamedata/configs/cache_dbg.ltx%c[ui_gray_2]) will keep trace of original parameters upon changing, so you can reset them back with Reset button. 
Don't forget to make a backup of the configs for reference. 
 
%c[pda_blue]Keybinds%c[ui_gray_2]
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Arrow keys: %c[ui_gray_2]parameters navigation. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 8/2: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce selected value. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 9/3: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce all values of selected parameter. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LShift (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 value step size / jump 2 parameters. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LAlt (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 value step size / jump 3 parameters. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 5: %c[ui_gray_2]copy current stats. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 6: %c[ui_gray_2]paste stored stats. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]G: %c[ui_gray_2]Toggle crosshair.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]H: %c[ui_gray_2]Show help window. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Esc: %c[ui_gray_2]turn off editor.

%c[ui_gray_1]Tronex 
2019/10/8 
Item Editor 
 
%c[pda_green]About%c[ui_gray_2] 
The item editor allows you to edit item configs and save/test your changes directly in-game. 
The GUI is interactive and easy to use, supporting weapons/outfits/artefacts editing. 
You can select a relative item in the list to compare its stats to your active item. 
Modified values are cached temporarly for the item you're working on, you can return to it if you turn the editor off. 
 
%c[pda_red]Attention%c[ui_gray_2] 
Items configs must be unpacked before working with the editor, they must be in (%c[ui_gray_3]gamedata/configs/items%c[ui_gray_2]). 
(%c[ui_gray_3]gamedata/configs/cache_dbg.ltx%c[ui_gray_2]) will keep trace of original parameters upon changing, so you can reset them back with Reset button. 
Don't forget to make a backup of the configs for reference. 
 
%c[pda_blue]Keybinds%c[ui_gray_2]
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Arrow keys: %c[ui_gray_2]parameters navigation. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 8/2: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce selected value. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 9/3: %c[ui_gray_2]increase/reduce all values of selected parameter. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LShift (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 value step size / jump 2 parameters. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]LAlt (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 value step size / jump 3 parameters. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 5: %c[ui_gray_2]copy current stats. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Numpad 6: %c[ui_gray_2]paste stored stats.
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]H: %c[ui_gray_2]Show help window. 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]Esc: %c[ui_gray_2]turn off editor.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The amount of damage incurred by the bullet. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter. 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]Each value for this parameter is used for a different difficulty: 
Master -> Veteran -> Stalker -> Novice 
Vanilla difficulty is not used in Anomaly, use the same value for all.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The physical force of a round. Higher values cause more dramatic ragdoll deaths. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The distance in meters before the bullet 'dies' - anything beyond this range will not be hit. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The rate of fire, in rounds per minute. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The rate at which the 'empty' sound file will play, if one tries to fire while empty. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Depth of field modifier when using iron-sights. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The amount of 'brakes' applied to the gun - how difficult it is to turn quickly and reliably. Notable on the PKm and SVD. Affects handling statistic. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The amount of inertia from maneuvering the camera - how likely your aim is to drift off target if you jerk. Affects handling statistic. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The basic cone of fire in degrees - how accurate the gun's first burst will be. Affects basic accuracy, and displayed accuracy statistic. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The probability of a misfire occurring at ANY time (This parameter is not used). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Weapon's condition at which the misfire chance starts to rise. 
Misfire won't happen on higher condition. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Jamming chance calculation%c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[ui_gray_3]Misfire chance on shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )

 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Weapon's condition where misfire chance stops rising. 
Misfire chance will cap at "misfire_end_prob" on lower condition. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Jamming chance calculation%c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[ui_gray_3]Misfire chance on shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )

 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The starting chance of misfiring. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Jamming chance calculation%c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[ui_gray_3]Misfire chance on shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )

 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The ending chance of misfire. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Jamming chance calculation%c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[ui_gray_3]Misfire chance on shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )

 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much condition is lost per shot. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Calculation 
%c[ui_gray_3]condition loss per shot = (condition_shot_dec) x (weapon_degredation) x (impair) x (condition_shot_dec_k) 
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"condition_shot_dec"%c[ui_gray_2] is defined per weapon section. Set "condition_queue_shot_dec" to the same value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"weapon_degredation"%c[ui_gray_2] is a console command, allowing in-game control for degredation in general (defaulted to 1) 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"impair"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the ammo section the weapon is currently using 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"condition_shot_dec_k"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the silencer section attached to the weapon (defaulted to 1 if it's missing)

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much condition is lost per shot in full-auto fire. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Calculation 
%c[ui_gray_3]condition loss per shot = (condition_shot_dec) x (weapon_degredation) x (impair) x (condition_shot_dec_k) 
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"condition_shot_dec"%c[ui_gray_2] is defined per weapon section. Set "condition_queue_shot_dec" to the same value 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"weapon_degredation"%c[ui_gray_2] is a console command, allowing in-game control for degredation in general (defaulted to 1) 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"impair"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the ammo section the weapon is currently using 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_3]"condition_shot_dec_k"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the silencer section attached to the weapon (defaulted to 1 if it's missing)

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Does the camera return to your target afterwards? 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which your crosshairs return to "neutral" 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree)

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Dispersion upon shooting (no aim). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree) 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]This value is not capped in engine, negative values will caused negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much is added to dispersion with each shot. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree) 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]This value is not capped in engine, negative values will caused negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The maximum angle recoil can carry your crosshair from origin - in this case, 50 degrees up. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Horizontal recoil caused by firing. 0 will cause a vertical recoil, negative will recoil to the left. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which your ironsights/scopes return to neutral. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree) 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_relax_speed" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Dispersion (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree) 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_dispersion" value instead. 
This value is not capped in engine, negative values will caused negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much is added to dispersion with each shot (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree) 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_dispersion_inc" value instead. 
This value is not capped in engine, negative values will caused negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Another factor into dispersion (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_dispersion_frac" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The maximum angle recoil can carry your crosshair from origin - in this case, 50 degrees up (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_max_angle" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Maximum horizontal offset (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_max_angle_horz" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Horizontal recoil caused by firing. 0 will cause a vertical recoil, negative will recoil to the left (only affecting ironsights/scopes). 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[pda_blue]Notes 
%c[ui_gray_2]if this parameter is not defined in weapon section, engine will use "cam_step_angle_horz" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Base "PDM". This effects accuracy similar to how fire_dispersion_base does. Lower value makes it more accurate. Also effects the handling stat of the weapon, alongside control_inertion_factor 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range 
 
%c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]A multiplier that increases bullet spread based on the player's velocity 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]A multiplier that increases bullet spread as the player accelerates 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that effects spread while the player is crouched 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that effects spread while the player is crouched, and not moving (basically at the player's most accurate) 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much condition effects dispersion - higher numbers result in more dramatic degradation. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How quickly the AI's aim restores after a burst. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which an AI restores aim after firing in ironsights/scopes.. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]An AI's effective seeing range when carrying the weapon. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]An AI's field of view when carrying the weapon. 1.0 gives it a roughly 180 field of view. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Minimum radius in which you can be seen, in meters. Can cause interesting hijinks. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Maximum radius at which AI can distinguish friend or foe. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How long it takes to aim down the sights. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]How much the FOV "zooms in" while aiming down the sights. 1 is default. 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]This number must equal the 'elapsed' variable - otherwise the value may not be either! 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description 
%c[ui_gray_2]Weapon base cost (bear in mind that it's affected by a lot of economy aspects) 
 
%c[pda_red]Range 
%c[ui_gray_2]$range
